intro: Tephrosia albifoliolis, commonly known as the white-leaf tephrosia, is a flowering plant native to tropical regions of Africa. It belongs to the Fabaceae family, which is characterized by its pod fruits and nitrogen-fixing capabilities. The plant features compound leaves with small, oval-shaped leaflets and produces small, yellowish-white flowers arranged in clusters. Its growth habit is typically shrub-like, with woody stems and a dense foliage structure. Tephrosia albifoliolis is often found in moist, well-drained soils and can thrive in both full sun and partial shade.
